result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Ray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 15CM350 and 15CF93, Court grants the State's motion.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense was just appointed as successor counsel and requests an adjournment and just received discovery. State advises this matter might resolve. Court will put the matter (15CF93) back on the jury status/jury trial. Files 15CM350 and 15CM138 to trail along.  Hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is not ready to enter a plea today and requests a jury status/jury trial date on 15CF93. 15CM138 and 15CM350 to trail along on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states they are working on a global resolution and requests another date for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's newest case addressed. These cases will all be resolved. Defense requests another date.  Court will give another date in 30 days.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense just received some discovery on 15CM138. Discovery needs to be prepared on 15CF93. Defense states the cases should resolve and requests another date.  Hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. He must also attend all his classes at school.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven A Ray
Current: 720 Scott Ave., #1, Waukesha, WI 53186   (Effective: 01-26-2015)
Prior: 806 Scott Ave #10, Waukesha, WI 53186
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
